list: This semi-gloss sheen is a lustrous, durable finish that is perfect for areas that require frequent cleaning and superior resistance to moisture; ideal for entryway doors, garage doors and accent trim
Dirt- and stain-blocking paint + primer quickly and easily hides existing stains, ground-in dirt and residue
Advanced All-Weather Protection shields the painted surface from harsh weather conditions, maintaining the beauty of your home's exterior
Outstanding hide and one-coat coverage in select colors helps your color go a long way, see guides and documents for a complete list of one-coat colors
Excellent adhesion to rough and porous surfaces like masonry, stucco and brick
Resilient 100% acrylic formula provides extra protection from cracking, peeling and blistering
Powerful defense against sunlight and moisture damage
Provides a mildew- and algae-resistant coating
Early moisture resistance guards the freshly painted surface from runs, blisters or watermarks once rain showers begin

questions.question: "can you use this on vinyl siding"
questions.author: Pam

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. Yes, Weathershield Exterior Paint can be applied on vinyl shutters that are properly prepared according to our label. Regards HGTV HOME by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, this can not be used on vinyl siding.

questions.question: "Can this paint be used on brick surfaces, exterior"
questions.author: Bill

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. Yes, you can apply our Weathershield paint product to properly prepared, sound brick. You will need to apply 1 coat of exterior primer for masonry surfaces, followed by 2 coats of our paint. Regards HGTV Home by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support

questions.question: "How do you remove this paint from clothing after it dries?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. There is not an easy way to remove the paint if it has dried and bonded to the fibers. You can try a stain remover such as Goof Off or Goo Gone but it may not take it off completely. Regards, HGTV HOME by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support

questions.question: "Can I spray this paint with a pneumatic spray gun. The type that has the built in can underneath the sprayer?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. This product can be brushed, rolled, or sprayed on the surface. Regards, HGTV HOME by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support

questions.question: "Where do you find the actual image of the colors, I saw the list but no color image."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. The best place to view the colors would be at your local Lowe's store. Regards, HGTV HOME by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support

questions.question: "Did this use to be called showcase?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. No, Weathershield and Showcase are two different products, we are still making both. Regards, HGTV HOME by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support

questions.question: "I just want pure white can this be used rite out of the can or is this a base?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. This paint should not be tinted and can just be used right out of the can. Regards, HGTV HOME by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support

questions.question: "Can this paint be thinned with water for spraying?"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. This paint should not be tinted, it can be sprayed right out of the can. Regards, HGTV HOME by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support

questions.question: "Can I use this paint on a factory primed steel door and if so do i have to sand it before painting."
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. The paint should adhere to the primer, however since it is not our product I recommend a test area first. Regards, HGTV HOME by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support

questions.question: "What is the average coverage on semi smooth surfaces"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: HGTV HOME by SW Support
answers.text: Hello. Typically a gallon covers 350 sq. feet but the amount can vary depending on the surface. Regards, HGTV HOME by Sherwin-Williams Customer Support
